Uber's expansion into Asia hit a snag Wednesday...
...when prosecutors in South Korea indicted the company's CEO, Travis Kalanick,...
...on the grounds that the service violates the country's transportation law.
The Seoul Central District Prosecutors' Office charged that Uber's service...
...and those of its competitors are unsafe...
...and violate a law that bans rental car operators...
...from competing with taxis to offer rides for free.
The company announced earlier this month...
...that it had secured 1.2 billion dollars in financing, prompting a 40-billion-dollar valuation.
